intro: Hymenanthes pontica, commonly known as the Caucasian hazel, is a deciduous shrub native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its slender, multi-stemmed structure. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in catkins, followed by edible, nut-like fruits. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges. Hymenanthes pontica is often found in moist, well-drained soils along riverbanks and in forested areas.
